description.raw:
Shrink compile and restart window, make it properly resizable, and give it a title.

Russ pointed out that the compile and restart window was too big for some small screens, hiding the dialog buttons. Even if the window manager (or the user) resizes the window to fit, the widgets were fixed in-place as the QDialog was not laid out properly - shrinking the window would just obscure the buttons and not actually shrink the output box.

This PR makes the window smaller, gives it a meaningful title (was previously '__main__.py') and lays it out so that the widgets actually resize with the window.

![blacs_cns.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/9pKE7ad/images/4271415261-blacs_cns.png)
